mainHeading: SomniSage: Sleep Stage Classification using Time Series Models
context: Capstone project exploring automated classification of sleep stages using deep learning models on physiological signal data (EEG, EOG, EMG), with the goal of improving sleep disorder diagnosis.
objectives: Researched sleep stage subtyping using Siamese and CNN-BiLSTM architectures.
Segmented and preprocessed time-series PSG recordings (197 whole-night sessions).
Engineered 2688-dimensional input vectors capturing temporal and spatial signal patterns.
Classified hypnograms into stages W, R, 1, 2, 3, 4, M, and unscored (‘?’).
Achieved 84.5% accuracy using CNN-BiLSTM for multi-class classification.
features: Combined temporal pattern recognition with spatial signal analysis.
Implemented custom Softmax layer for 8-class sleep stage scoring.
Preprocessed noisy signals from EEG, EMG, and EOG recordings.
Trained and evaluated deep learning models using TensorFlow.
Proposed future extension with knowledge graph modeling for sleep disorders.
